Source documentation¶

class pyaln.Alignment(file_or_iter=None, fileformat=None, tuples=None)¶

This is the mighty alignment class

Truly, it’s very very alignypoweryfully - parameters, types, return and return types:

:param arg1: description
:param arg2: description
:type arg1: type description
:type arg1: type description
:return: return description
:rtype: the return type description

  • and to provide sections such as Example using the double commas syntax:

    :Example:

followed by a blank line !

    which appears as follow:

    Example

    followed by a blank line

  • Finally special sections such as See Also, Warnings, Notes use the sphinx syntax (paragraph directives):

    .. seealso:: blabla
.. warnings also:: blabla
.. note:: blabla
.. todo:: blabla

Note

There are many other Info fields but they may be redundant:

  • param, parameter, arg, argument, key, keyword: Description of a parameter.

  • type: Type of a parameter.

  • raises, raise, except, exception: That (and when) a specific exception is raised.

  • var, ivar, cvar: Description of a variable.

  • returns, return: Description of the return value.

  • rtype: Return type.

add_seq(title, sequence, desc=None)¶
